edu.ycp.cs201.cards

Class KlondikeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ycp.cs201.cards.KlondikeController

  • public class KlondikeController
extends java.lang.Object
    The controller class implements all of the logic required to play a game of Klondike. All of the data is represented in a KlondikeModel object, and each controller method takes a reference to the model object as a parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • initModel

        public void initModel(KlondikeModel model)
        Initialize the model object. Should populate and shuffle the main deck, and then deal cards from the main deck onto the seven tableau piles. It should set the expose index of each tableau pile so that only the top card is exposed. It should set the expose index of the main deck so that only the top card is exposed. It should set the expose index of the waste pile so that no cards can ever be exposed (i.e., set it to a high value, such that even if it contains all 52 cards, none of them would be exposed). It should set the expose index of each foundation pile to 0.
        Parameters:
        model - the KlondikeModel object to initialize

      • select

        public Selection select(KlondikeModel model,
               Location location)

        Attempt to create a Selection that represents one or more Cards to be moved from a pile indicated by a Location. The Location specifies which pile to move cards from, and which card or cards within the pile should be moved. Note that this method must check to see whether the proposed move is legal: it should return null if it is not legal to move the card or cards indicated by the Location.

        If the Location has LocationType.MAIN_DECK as its location type, then the main deck must not be empty, the selected card must be the top card on the main deck.

        If the Location has LocationType.TABLEAU_PILE as its location type, then the Location's card index must refer to a valid card, and the card index must be greater than or equal to the tableau pile's expose index.

        It is not legal to move cards from the waste pile or from a foundation pile, so if the Location's location type is LocationType.WASTE_PILE or LocationType.FOUNDATION_PILE, then the method should return null.

        If the move is legal, the indicated cards should be removed from the source pile (as indicated by the Location), and transfered into the Selection object returned from the method.

        Parameters:
        model - the KlondikeModel
        location - the Location specifying which card or cards to move
        Returns:
        a Selection containing the cards to move and the Location, or null if the Location does not indicate a legal location from which cards can be moved

      • unselect

        public void unselect(KlondikeModel model,
            Selection selection)
        "Undo" a selection by moving cards from a Selection object back to the pile they were taken from, as indicated by the selection's origin Location. For example, if the location indicates that the selection's cards were taken from a tableau pile, then they should be moved back to that tableau pile.
        Parameters:
        model - the KlondikeModel
        selection - the Selection to undo

      • allowMove

        public boolean allowMove(KlondikeModel model,
                Selection selection,
                Location dest)

        Determine whether it is legal to move the current Selection to a destination pile indicated by a Location.

        If the destination Location has LocationType.FOUNDATION_PILE as its LocationType, then the Selection must contain a single card. If the foundation pile is empty, then the selected card must be an Rank.ACE. If the foundation pile is not empty, then the selected card must have the same suit as the top card on the foundation pile, and the ordinal value of its Rank must be one greater than the top card on the foundation pile.

        If the destination Location has LocationType.TABLEAU_PILE as its LocationType, then:

        • If the destination tableau pile is empty, the bottom card of the Selection must be Rank.KING
        • If the destination tableau pile is not empty, the bottom card of the Selection must have a Suit that is a different Color than the top card of the tableau pile, and the bottom card of the Selection must have an Rank whose ordinal value is one less than the ordinal value of the top card of the tableau pile.

        If the destination Location has LocationType.MAIN_DECK or LocationType.WASTE_PILE as its LocationType, then the move is not legal.

        Note that this method just checks to see whether or not a move would be legal: it does not move any cards.

        Parameters:
        model - the KlondikeModel
        selection - the Selection
        dest - the destination Location
        Returns:
        true if the move is legal, false if the move is not legal

      • moveCards

        public void moveCards(KlondikeModel model,
             Selection selection,
             Location dest)

        Move the cards in a Selection onto a pile as indicated by the destination Location.

        The method does not need to check whether or not the move is legal: it can assume that the allowMove(KlondikeModel, Selection, Location) method has already determined that the move is legal.

        Important: If the pile that the selected cards were taken from is non-empty, and if its top card is not exposed, then its top card should be exposed.

        Note that the expose index of the destination pile should not change.

        Parameters:
        model - the KlondikeModel
        selection - the Selection containing the selected cards
        dest - the destination Location

      • drawCardOrRecycleWaste

        public void drawCardOrRecycleWaste(KlondikeModel model)

        If the main deck is not empty, then remove the top card from the main deck and add it to the waste pile. If the main deck is empty, then all cards should be moved from the waste pile back to the main deck.

        Note: when the waste pile is recycled, it should move cards back to the main deck such that they are in the same order in which they originally occurred. In other words, drawing all of the cards from the main deck and then moving them back to the main deck should result in the main deck being in its original order.

        Before this method returns, it should check whether the main deck is non-empty, and if it is non-empty, it should ensure that the top card on the main deck is exposed.

        Parameters:
        model - the KlondikeModel

      • isWin

        public boolean isWin(KlondikeModel model)
        Determine if the player has won the game.
        Parameters:
        model - the KlondikeModel
        Returns:
        true if each foundation pile has 13 cards, false otherwise
